intro: Hypericum schimperi var. huillense, commonly known as the Huillén hypericum, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Ecuador. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, oval-shaped berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in Andean cloud forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
